satellites.name: Sputnik 1
satellites.overview: First artificial Earth satellite, launched the Space Age, measured upper-atmosphere density and ionospheric radio propagation.

satellites.name: Sputnik 2
satellites.overview: Second satellite, carried Laika, the first animal to orbit Earth.

satellites.name: Explorer 1
satellites.overview: First US satellite; discovered the Van Allen radiation belts.

satellites.name: Vanguard 1
satellites.overview: First satellite powered by solar cells and one of the oldest human-made objects still in orbit; used to study Earth's shape.

satellites.name: TIROS-1
satellites.overview: First operational meteorological satellite; demonstrated weather observation from space.

satellites.name: Echo 1
satellites.overview: Passive communications satellite (giant reflective balloon) that pioneered satellite-based signal relay.

satellites.name: Telstar 1
satellites.overview: First active communications satellite; enabled live transatlantic television transmission.

satellites.name: Intelsat I (Early Bird)
satellites.overview: First commercial geostationary communications satellite; provided regular US-Europe connectivity.

satellites.name: Transit 1B
satellites.overview: First operational satellite navigation system (Transit), precursor to modern GNSS.

satellites.name: Explorer 6
satellites.overview: First satellite to take a crude image of Earth from orbit.

satellites.name: Landsat 1 (ERTS-1)
satellites.overview: First civilian Earth observation satellite designed for long-term resource monitoring.

satellites.name: Hubble Space Telescope
satellites.overview: Revolutionized astronomy with deep images, direct observations of galaxies, black holes, and the universe's age; serviceable in orbit.

satellites.name: Navstar GPS I (Block I)
satellites.overview: Early satellites in the GPS constellation; enabled real-time precision navigation worldwide.

satellites.name: Skylab
satellites.overview: First American space station; enabled extended human habitation and scientific research in orbit.

satellites.name: CubeSat
satellites.overview: Standard small satellite form factor; democratized access to space for universities, startups, and research.
